filters.Description: the dimensionality of the output space [i.e.the number of output filters in the convolution]

data_format.Description: A string, one of channels_last [default] or channels_first.

kernel_size.Description: Specifies the height and width of the 2D convolution window

strides.Description: Specifies the strides of the convolution along the height and width.

padding.Description: "valid" means no padding. "same" results in padding evenly to the left/right or up/down of the input such that output has the same height/width dimension as the input.

kernel_initializer.Description: Initializer for the kernel weights matrix

units.Description: Positive integer, dimensionality of the output space.

use_bias.Description: Boolean, whether the layer uses a bias vector.

kernel_initializer.Description: Initializer for the kernel weights matrix

units.Description: Positive integer, dimensionality of the output space.

activation.Description: Activation function to use. Default: hyperbolic tangent [tanh]. If you pass None, no activation is applied [ie. "linear " activation: a[x] = x]

recurrent_activation.Description: Activation function to use for the recurrent step. Default: sigmoid [sigmoid]. If you pass None, no activation is applied [ie. "linear " activation: a[x] = x].

kernel_initializer.Description: Initializer for the kernel weights matrix

dropout.Description: Float between 0 and 1. Fraction of the units to drop for the linear transformation of the inputs. Default: 0.

return_sequences.Description: Boolean. Whether to return the last output. in the output sequence, or the full sequence. Default: False

return_state.Description: Boolean. Whether to return the last state in addition to the output. Default: False.

units.Description: Positive integer, dimensionality of the output space.

activation.Description: Activation function to use. Default: hyperbolic tangent [tanh]. If you pass None, no activation is applied [ie. "linear " activation: a[x] = x]

use_bias.Description: Boolean, whether the layer uses a bias vector.

dropout.Description: Float between 0 and 1. Fraction of the units to drop for the linear transformation of the inputs. Default: 0.

rate.Description: Float between 0 and 1. Fraction of the input units to drop.

noise_shape.Description: 1D integer tensor representing the shape of the binary dropout mask that will be multiplied with the input. For instance, if your inputs have shape [batch_size, timesteps, features] and you want the dropout mask to be the same for all timesteps, you can use noise_shape=[batch_size, 1, features]

seed.Description: A Python integer to use as random seed

data_format.Description: A string, one of channels_last [default] or channels_first.

padding.Description: The tuple interpreted as [[top_pad, bottom_pad], [left_pad, right_pad]]

data_format.Description: A string, one of channels_last [default] or channels_first.

pool_size.Description: integer or tuple of 2 integers, factors by which to downscale [vertical, horizontal]. [2, 2] will halve the input in both spatial dimension. If only one integer is specified, the same window length will be used for both dimensions

strides.Description: Tuple of 2 integers, or None. Strides values. If None, it will default to pool_size.

data_format.Description: A string, one of channels_last [default] or channels_first.

padding.Description: "valid" means no padding. "same" results in padding evenly to the left/right or up/down of the input such that output has the same height/width dimension as the input.

pool_size.Description: integer or tuple of 2 integers, factors by which to downscale [vertical, horizontal]. [2, 2] will halve the input in both spatial dimensions. If only one integer is specified, the same window length will be used for both dimensions

strides.Description: Tuple of 2 integers, or None. Strides values. If None, it will default to pool_size.

data_format.Description: A string, one of channels_last [default] or channels_first.

padding.Description: "valid" means no padding. "same" results in padding evenly to the left/right or up/down of the input such that output has the same height/width dimension as the input.
